computer.description:
The Acorn Archimedes A3000 was replaced by the Acorn A3010 and A3020, two simililar but slightly different models, aimed at the home and educational market.
See common features text in A3020 page.
For the first time, the A3010 was sold in electrical retail stores, next to the Amiga A1200 and Atari Falcon 030, as well as 486 class PCs which where starting to become popular in UK homes.
The Acorn A3010 had two Atari style joystick ports, green function keys and, previously unheard of in the Archimedes family, an RF port for TV, which the A3020 did not have.
There was a little known rare German version of the A3010 which had grey rather than green keys and a German QWERTZ keyboard.
Information supplied by Jonathan Hayward

item.description: 486 card||||||<br><font color="red"><strong>> 486 CARD</strong></font><br><blockquote>Allowed Archimedes series computers to run 32-bit PC-DOS software. It was delivered with a manual, a driver disk and PC-DOS 6.3</blockquote>

Graphics accelerator||||||<br><font color="red"><strong>> GRAPHICS ACCELERATOR</strong></font><br><blockquote>Graphics accelerator card (called "ColourCard") for A3000, Archimedes and A5000.<br> Company : Computer Concepts<br> Enhanced potential for Archimedes series including 15-bit desktop modes (i.e. 800*600 @ 256 colours).<p class="petitgris">Thanks to <b>Chris Syntichakis</b></p></blockquote>

Cumana SCSI card||||||<br><font color="red"><strong>> CUMANA SCSI CARD</strong></font><br><blockquote>16-bit SCSI-1 card<br> Company: Cumana.<br> There are an external port for scanners/CD-ROM etc. and 2 internal ports for SCSI and Floptical drives.<p class="petitgris">Thanks to <b>Chris Syntichakis</b> </p></blockquote>

Serial card||||||<br><font color="red"><strong>> SERIAL CARD</strong></font><br><blockquote>From Atomwide's site:<br><font color="#666666"> High speed serial card featuring three ports, each in the shape of a standard 9-pin ‘D’ plug. Each port on the card is capable of running at up to 460,800 bits per second, and employs a 16-byte FIFO buffer to reduce loading on the host computer’s processor, so improving communications reliability. All serial cards are standard single-width podules, and are fully compatible with Atomwide 6 and 8-slot RiscPC backplanes.</font> </blockquote>
MIDI card||||||<br><font color="red"><strong>> MIDI CARD</strong></font><br><blockquote>Allowed Archimedes systems to interact with any midi sound device.</blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> MAINBOARD</strong></font><br><blockquote>The mainboard design is quite similar to that of the Archimedes 320. The main differences are:<br> <b>(1)</b> An RF modulator allowing a TV set to bet used as video monitor<br> <b>(2)</b> Two Atari compatible joystick connectors<br> <b>(3)</b> A different RAM configuration. Two soldered chips hold the 1 MB base memory. Additional memory could be added by using DIP chips.</blockquote>
